COURSE/DEGREE AWARDING 
INSTITUTIONS  
DIRECT ENTRY  UTME  UTME SUBJECTS  SPECIAL CONSIDERATION (WAIVER) REMARKS  
    (viii) FED-DUTSINMA requires Literature in English, one 
(1) other Arts subject and another Arts or Social 
Science subject.  
(ix) LAGOS requires Literaturein English and any two 
(2) of the following subjects CRS/IS, French, 
History, Government and any Nigerian Language.  
(x) NTNU accepts any three (3) Arts or Social Science 
subjects.  
(xi) SLUK accepts any two (2) Arts subjects and one (1) 
other Arts or Social Science subject.  
(xii) SOSU accepts two (2) Arts subjects and any other 
Social Science subject.  
ENGLISH AND LITERARY 
STUDIES

Two (2) ‘A’ level passes 
to include Literature in 
English and one (1) 
other Arts subject.  
  
Five (5) SSC credit passes to 
include Literature in English 
and English Language.  
  
Literature in 
English, one (1) 
other Arts subject 
and another Arts or 
Social S cience 
subjects.  
  
DIRECT   ENTRY  
(i) AAUA  accepts  ND  upper  credit  in 
 Mass  
Communication. AAUA does not accept NCE.  
(ii) ABU accepts  
a) two (2) ‘A’ level passes including English 
Language at IJMB/NCE.    
b) General English/Use of English at NCE 
satisfiesthe UTMEEnglish requirements.  
(iii) ABUJA –same as English Language.  
(iv) CALABAR accepts NCE with English Literature as 
the teaching subject.  
(v) CHRISTOPHER accepts HND, ND or NCE with 
credit  passes  in  the  relevant 
programmes/subjects.  
(vi) NDU requires pass in Literature in English at the 
‘A’ level or NCE merit and a pass in at least 
anyArts subject.  
(vii) OAU same as in English Language.  
(viii) UNIOSUN accepts two (2) 'A'  level passes to 
include Literature in English and other  
Artssubjects or NCE in English/Political Science   
(ix) UNN accepts NCE merit in English Language in 
addition to the UTME requirements.
